item.title: 研究显示，美联储在抗击通胀方面行动胜于雄辩
item.description: 根据堪萨斯城联储在怀俄明州杰克逊霍尔举行的年度研究会议上发表的最新研究报告，美联储在金融市场眼中的信誉有助于其在过去两年中与通胀的斗争，但必须通过加息重新赢得信誉，以支持决策者恢复价格稳定的口头承诺。【原文：The Federal Reserve's credibility in the eyes of financial markets helped in its battle against inflation over the past two years, but it had to be earned afresh with interest rate hikes that backed up policymakers' verbal promises to restore price stability, according to new research presented at the Kansas City Fed's annual research conference in Jackson Hole, Wyoming.】

item.title: 瑞士财长就 "定时炸弹 "债务水平斥责美欧
item.description: 瑞士财政部长卡琳-凯勒-萨特（Karin Keller-Sutter）在周六出版的一份报纸采访中说，美国和欧洲的债务水平对国际金融稳定和瑞士都是一个风险。【原文：Debt levels in the United States and Europe are a risk for international financial stability and for Switzerland, Swiss Finance Minister Karin Keller-Sutter said in a newspaper interview published on Saturday.】

item.title: 纵火袭击后，新墨西哥州的星巴克被昵称为 "Charbucks"。
item.description: 在新墨西哥州陶斯的星巴克建筑工地发生两起纵火案后，一位开发商再次尝试在这个曾发生过起义和一些人反对全国连锁店的山城建造星巴克的第一家汽车咖啡店。【原文：After two arson attacks at a Starbucks construction site in Taos, New Mexico, a developer is trying again to build the chain's first drive-through cafe in the mountain town with a history of revolts and opposition by some to national chains.】

item.title: 国媒称中国根据市场原则规范债券市场
item.description: 周六，中国国家媒体报道称，中国金融监管部门根据市场原则，从宏观审慎和合规的角度对债券市场进行监管，驳斥了干预市场的说法。【原文：China's financial regulators approach bond market oversight based on market principles and from macro-prudential and compliance perspectives, state media on Saturday, rejecting claims of market intervention.】

item.title: IMF 古林查斯称美国降息是正确的，但通胀风险并未消失
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）经济参赞皮埃尔-奥利维耶-古林查斯（Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas）周五表示，美国联邦储备委员会即将实施的降息计划 "符合 "国际货币基金组织的建议，即重视确保通货膨胀得到控制，但现在认为风险已转向劳动力市场。【原文：The imminent rate cuts planned by the U.S. Federal Reserve are "in line" with International Monetary Fund advice that has put a premium on ensuring inflation was controlled but now sees risks shifting toward the labor market, IMF economic counsellor Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas said on Friday.】

item.title: 诺福克南方公司与四个工会达成协议
item.description: 诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern）与 BNSF 铁路公司合作，于周五表示已与四个工会达成为期五年的临时集体谈判协议。【原文：Norfolk Southern , in partnership with BNSF Railway, said on Friday it has reached tentative, five-year collective bargaining agreements with four labor unions.】

item.title: 据《每日电讯报》报道，礼来公司的阿尔茨海默氏症药物将被禁止在国家医疗服务系统中使用
item.description: 据英国《每日电讯报》周五报道，礼来公司治疗早期阿尔茨海默氏症的药物预计将被英国国家医疗服务系统（NHS）禁止使用。【原文：Eli Lilly's treatment for early Alzheimer's is expected to be blocked for use by Britain's National Health Service (NHS), the Telegraph reported on Friday.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，布朗夫曼对派拉蒙的竞购可能会让莎莉-雷德斯通继续参与其中
item.description: 据 CNBC 周五报道，如果派拉蒙全球公司的特别委员会接受他的财团对控股股东 National Amusements 的收购，小埃德加-布朗夫曼（Edgar Bronfman Jr.【原文：Edgar Bronfman Jr. is open to having Shari Redstone remain involved with Paramount Global if its special committee accepts his consortium's bid for National Amusements, the controlling shareholder, CNBC reported on Friday.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻："超级碗 "英伟达财报考验炙手可热的人工智能交易
item.description: 下周，芯片制造巨头英伟达（Nvidia）将发布财报，美股的反弹面临重要考验。【原文：The rally in U.S. stocks faces an important test next week with earnings from chipmaking giant Nvidia , whose blistering run has powered markets throughout 2024.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，苹果公司计划于 9 月 10 日推出新款 iPhone、AirPods 和手表
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周五援引知情人士的话报道称，苹果公司正计划于 9 月 10 日举行今年最大规模的产品发布会，届时将推出最新款 iPhone、手表和 AirPods。【原文：Apple is planning its biggest product launch event of the year on Sept. 10, during which it will unveil the latest iPhones, watches and AirPods, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 鲍威尔领导的美联储不讳言大选年削减开支，准备捍卫就业市场
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周五明确表示，美国央行不会回避在总统竞选的最后几周转向降息，保护就业市场是其目前的首要任务。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell made it clear on Friday the U.S. central bank would not shy away from pivoting to interest rate cuts in the final weeks of a presidential election campaign and that protecting the job market was now its top priority.】

item.title: 研究表明，美国国债已不再是安全的赌注
item.description: 不比外滩安全。或金条。或 OAT。【原文：No safer than a bund. Or a gilt. Or an OAT.】

item.title: 加拿大铁路停运仍可能推迟西部谷物出口
item.description: 贸易商和分析师说，尽管加拿大政府已采取行动结束该国最大的两条铁路的停运，但加拿大铁路停运仍可能会延误该国西海岸港口一些散装谷物船的装运。【原文：Canada's rail shutdown may still delay loading of some bulk grain ships at the country's west-coast ports despite the government's move to end a stoppage at the nation's two largest railroads, traders and analysts said.】

item.title: 公司称起诉银行的花旗集团前高管因工作表现被解雇
item.description: 花旗集团称，起诉该银行的一名前董事总经理被解雇的原因是工作表现，而不是她所说的银行试图向监管机构提供虚假信息。【原文：Citigroup alleges that a former managing director suing the bank was fired for performance reasons, rather than for what she said were attempts by the bank to give regulators false information.】

item.title: 美联储转向鸽派对日本央行加息计划喜忧参半
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会的鸽派转变可能会给日本央行在抑制日元疲软的斗争中带来一些喘息的机会，但如果这两家央行的政策路径分歧使市场感到不安，则可能会使日本央行的加息努力复杂化。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve's dovish shift will likely give the Bank of Japan some respite in its battle to tame a weak yen, but could complicate its efforts to raise interest rates if the two central banks' diverging policy paths keep markets jittery.】

item.title: J&J公司正在就65亿美元的滑石粉和解协议与持异议者进行谈判
item.description: 强生公司（Johnson & Johnson）周五表示，该公司正在与反对该公司就婴儿爽身粉和其他滑石粉产品致癌诉讼达成和解的原告律师进行谈判，以消除对该协议的坚持。【原文：Johnson & Johnson said on Friday it is negotiating with plaintiffs' lawyers who have opposed the company's proposed settlement of lawsuits alleging its baby powder and other talc products caused cancer, seeking to eliminate holdouts to the deal.】

item.title: 美国要求调查倍耐力墨西哥工厂涉嫌侵犯劳工权利事件
item.description: 美国周五表示，已要求墨西哥审查轮胎制造商倍耐力（Pirelli）位于维多利亚西劳市（Silao de la Victoria）的工厂涉嫌侵犯工人权利的行为，这是美国根据2020年贸易协定在墨西哥提出的第26起劳工投诉。【原文：The United States said on Friday it had asked Mexico to review alleged worker rights violations at tire maker Pirelli's facility in Silao de la Victoria city, the 26th U.S. labor complaint in Mexico under a 2020 trade pact.】

item.title: 美联储古尔斯比当前的利率政策对经济过于紧缩
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周五表示，虽然他还没有准备好明确要求央行降息，但货币政策已经相当紧缩，不再符合当前的经济状况。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said Friday that while he's not ready to explicitly call for a central bank rate cut, monetary policy is quite tight and is no longer aligned with current economic conditions.】

item.title: Meta、Spotify 首席执行官抨击欧洲人工智能法规
item.description: Meta 公司首席执行官马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）和 Spotify 公司首席执行官丹尼尔-埃克（Daniel Ek）批评了欧洲有关开源人工智能的法规，称欧洲大陆有可能因为复杂的规则而落后。【原文：Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Spotify CEO Daniel Ek have critisised European regulations surrounding open-source artificial intelligence, saying the continent risks falling behind because of complex rules.】

item.title: 由于对牛排和沙拉的强劲需求提升了预测，卡瓦升至历史新高
item.description: 周五，地中海连锁餐厅卡瓦集团（Cava Group）的股价飙升逾 23%，创下 125.38 美元的历史新高，原因是对其沙拉碗和皮塔饼的强劲需求提升了其年销售额和盈利预期。【原文：Mediterranean restaurant chain Cava Group's shares surged over 23% to a record high of $125.38 on Friday, after strong demand for its salad bowls and pita wraps boosted its annual sales and earnings forecast.】

item.title: 微软将在 CrowdStrike 引发 IT 故障后举办网络安全峰会
item.description: 在 CrowdStrike 的错误更新导致上个月全球 IT 系统中断后，微软周五表示将于 9 月份召开一次关于改进网络安全系统的峰会。【原文：Microsoft said on Friday it would hold a summit in September on improving cybersecurity systems, after a faulty update from CrowdStrike caused a global IT outage last month.】

item.title: 据《信息报》报道，Meta 取消了高端混合现实头盔计划
item.description: 据《信息报》周五援引两名 Meta 公司员工的话报道，Meta Platforms 公司已经取消了旨在与苹果公司 Vision Pro 竞争的高端混合现实头盔的计划。【原文：Meta Platforms has canceled plans for a premium mixed-reality headset intended to compete with Apple's Vision Pro, the Information reported on Friday, citing two Meta employees.】

item.title: 美国司法部指控 RealPage 哄抬房租
item.description: 美国司法部和八个州周五起诉 RealPage，指控这家物业管理软件公司利用算法帮助房东非法串通，抬高公寓租金。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice and eight states sued RealPage on Friday, accusing the property management software company of using algorithms to help landlords illegally collude and drive up rents for apartments.】

item.title: 英镑兑美元升至 2022 年 3 月以来最高点
item.description: 周五，英镑兑美元汇率攀升至两年多来的新高，原因是近期有迹象表明英国经济强劲，而且美联储主席鲍威尔发表了鸽派言论，导致美元兑多种全球货币汇率下滑。【原文：Sterling climbed to a more than two-year high on the dollar on Friday, on recent signs of strength in the UK economy and dovish comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell that sent the dollar sliding against several global currencies.】

item.title: 中国智能手机制造商荣耀获得中国移动投资
item.description: 中国智能手机制造商荣耀周五表示，已从中国移动母公司获得一笔金额未公开的投资，这家前华为（HWT.UL）部门正在为首次公开募股（IPO）做准备。【原文：Chinese smartphone maker Honor said on Friday it has received an undisclosed amount of investment from China Mobile's parent company, as the former Huawei (HWT.UL) unit gears up towards an initial public offering (IPO).】

item.title: 即时观点：鲍威尔为 9 月降息开绿灯
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔周五表示，美国央行降息的 "时机已经到来"，因为就业市场风险上升，没有进一步疲软的余地，而且通胀率已达到美联储2%的目标，这明确表示美联储即将放宽政策。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Friday "the time has come" for the U.S. central bank to cut interest rates as rising risks to the job market left no room for further weakness and inflation was in reach of the Fed's 2% target, offering an explicit endorsement of an imminent policy easing.】

item.title: 研究显示，美国就业市场可能已接近临界点
item.description: 随着通胀率在 2023 年快速下降，并在今年继续放缓，美联储官员感到欣慰的是，美国经济的蒸汽似乎不是通过失业率上升，而是通过企业在大流行病时期劳动力短缺高峰期发布的大量职位空缺的减少而释放出来的。【原文：As inflation fell fast in 2023 and continued to slow this year, Federal Reserve officials were cheered that the steam seemed to come out of the U.S. economy not through rising unemployment but rather a decline in the large number of job openings businesses posted during the peak of the pandemic-era labor shortage.】

item.title: 美国制裁 400 家援助俄罗斯战争的实体，其中包括中国公司
item.description: 美国国务院周五表示，美国对400多个支持俄罗斯乌克兰战争的实体和个人实施了制裁，其中包括美国官员认为正在帮助莫斯科规避西方制裁并加强军事力量的中国公司。【原文：The United States on Friday imposed sanctions on more than 400 entities and individuals for supporting Russia's war effort in Ukraine, the State Department said, including Chinese companies that U.S. officials believe are helping Moscow skirt Western sanctions and build up its military.】

item.title: 英镑兑美元升至两年多来最高点
item.description: 周五，英镑兑美元汇率升至两年多来的高点，因为在美国预计很快将开始一系列降息之际，投资者从英国经济强劲的迹象中得到了安慰。【原文：Sterling rose to a more than two-year high versus the dollar on Friday, as investors took comfort from signs of strength in the British economy at a time when the United States is expected to soon embark on a series of interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 肯尼亚 Safaricom 公司敦促对 Starlink 等卫星供应商提出新要求
item.description: 肯尼亚最大的电信公司 Safaricom 已敦促监管机构考虑要求卫星互联网提供商（如埃隆-马斯克的 Starlink 公司）与当地移动网络运营商合作。【原文：Kenya's biggest telecoms company Safaricom has urged regulators to consider requiring satellite internet providers such as Elon Musk's Starlink to partner with local mobile network operators.】
